description: For 100 years, the BMW Group has been inspiring people worldwide with unique mobility experiences. The special fascination of the BMW Group lies not only in its products and technology, but also in the company’s history, written by inventors, pioneers and brilliant designers. Today, the BMW Group, with its 31 production and assembly facilities in 14 countries as well as a global sales network, is the world’s leading manufacturer of premium automobiles and motorcycles, and provider of premium mobility and financial services.   Constantly evolving to stay a decisive step ahead has always been the intent guiding the BMW Group’s thinking and actions as a company. Therefore, especially in the context of its centenary, the company is looking into the future and considering today the mobility concepts of tomorrow.   Our employees are the foundation of the BMW Group's success. Their professional qualification and commitment are outstanding. In return, we offer safe and attractive jobs and comprehensive opportunities for personal development and qualification.

“Vorsprung durch Technik” – with pioneering courage and team spirit, Audi employees breathe new life into those words each and every day. Applying critical thought to the status quo, they bring unique and innovative ideas to fruition in a work atmosphere of creative freedom where the seemingly distant future is already taking shape. That’s why such upcoming fields as piloted driving, connectivity or digitalisation of production are already part of Audi’s core areas of expertise today. That’s why such up-and-coming fields as piloted driving, connectivity or digitalisation of production are already part of Audi’s core areas of expertise today. And this applies not just to our sites in Ingolstadt and Neckarsulm in Germany but also to our locations in China, Belgium, Mexico and Hungary. As an internationally expanding organisation we offer a wide range of jobs and opportunities for professional development around the globe.

Today, around 60,000 people at the German sites in Ingolstadt and Neckarsulm and over 85,000 employees worldwide are working to set standards internationally for  innovation and quality. It is specifically the motivation, commitment and enthusiasm of the employees for the Audi brand and its products which makes these successes possible.

Those who would like to be a part of the Audi success story will find attractive employment and development opportunities for students, graduates and (young) professionals. All information regarding your future at Audi can be found at www.audi.com/careers and www.vorsprung-bei-audi.de

Imprint: http://bit.ly/1Gv4eBS

Continental develops intelligent technologies for transporting people and their goods. As a reliable partner, the international automotive supplier, tire manufacturer, and industrial partner provides sustainable, safe, comfortable, individual, and affordable solutions. In 2015, the corporation generated sales of €39.2 billion with its five divisions, Chassis & Safety, Interior, Powertrain, Tires, and ContiTech. Continental currently employs more than 218,000 people in 55 countries.

HELLA KGaA Hueck & Co., Lippstadt: HELLA is a global, family-owned company, listed on the stock exchange, with around 34,000 employees at over 125 locations in more than 35 countries. The HELLA Group develops and manufactures lighting, electronic components and systems for the automotive industry. HELLA also has one of the largest trade organizations for automotive parts, accessories, diagnostics, and services within Europe. Complete vehicle modules, air-conditioning systems, and vehicle electrical systems are also produced in joint venture companies. With more than 6,000 people working in research and development, HELLA is one of the most important innovation drivers on the market. In addition, with sales of approx. 6.4 billion euros in fiscal year 2015/2016, the HELLA Group is one of the top 40 automotive parts suppliers in the world and one of the 100 largest German industrial companies.

At the same time, HELLA is a family-run company that has been planning and acting with vision for over 100 years. An employer that knows that success, security, satisfaction and trust are important prerequisites for every individual's innovative power. That, by conviction, offers outstanding development opportunities and has anchored reconciliation of family and professional life in its DNA. For this reason, we attract people that are looking for both: Innovation and tradition, freedom and responsibility, challenges and security. People with vision.

Further information is available online at www.hella.com

“In the beginning I looked around and could not find quite the car I dreamed of. So I decided to build it myself.“

This quote from Ferry Porsche gets to the heart of everything that makes Porsche what it is. As a company, as an automotive manufacturer and as an employer. It has been our guiding star – for more than 65 years. Porsche is a unique company with strong ideals. Everything we do is characterized by our values and philosophy. Regardless of what others are doing, we are always endeavouring to redefine our limits and set new standards.

Experience the fascination Porsche: As an employer, Porsche offers you the unique combination of a dynamic and international  working environment and an almost family-like atmosphere in which you are appreciated and actively encouraged as a person. The flat hierarchical structures in the company enable short paths of communication and decision-making. You work in an atmosphere of autonomy in close collaboration with other departments and, above all, on interesting subjects in a fascinating field. Our employees often think unconventionally, but we support that at Porsche because we value originality and individuality. What’s more, we support our employees, especially when it comes to balancing the many demands of private and professional life, with individual solutions customized for each member of staff.

Developing the technology of tomorrow. Always surpassing yourself. Working at Porsche offers many challenges. What might it be like? On our website www.porsche.com/careers you can get insights into the Porsche working environment and experience first-hand what makes working at Porsche so fascinating.

Here you can view our job offeres based on your preferences. Take your chance and apply online: jobs.porsche.com

News, background stories and more about Porsche: www.newsroom.porsche.com

Legal notice: http://www.porsche.com/germany/legal-notice/
specialities: Development, production and distribution of exclusive sports cars

description:
We are a partner to the international automobile industry and deliver our mechatronic systems and electric drives to about 80 automotive manufacturers and more than 40 suppliers. Approximately 24,000 employees work for Brose at 60 locations in 23 countries on all major automotive markets worldwide. 

We generated sales of 6 billion euros in fiscal year 2015. Currently, Brose is the fifth-largest family-owned company among the top 100 automotive suppliers worldwide.

We make use of our expertise in mechanics, electrics and electronics gained over decades to find the right solutions tailor-made for the needs of our customers. 

The focus is on new products designed to cut fuel consumption, thus helping to reduce CO2 emissions. At the same time, our components and systems enable us to contribute toward making automobiles safer and more comfortable to use. 

Our goal is to extend our development and quality leadership even further. Moreover, we intend to step up our worldwide activities, particularly in Asia. 

Through innovative capability, leading edge manufacturing technology and logistics, above all, through strategic investments and a stable ownership structure, we seek to have a long-term partnership with the automakers.

BENTELER Automotive is a family with a passion for success through excellence. 
With our products and solutions, we provide answers to the key issues of tomorrow, namely safety, the environment, and efficiency. We support the evolving needs of our customers with a high level of expertise in the multi-material mix as well as a strategic focus on the module business.

BENTELER Automotive develops and produces innovative products. A deep understanding of materials and processes as well as a high degree of production expertise are the basis of our success. We see ourselves as an agile and reliable global business partner. As a full-service supplier, we provide most of the major 
automobile manufacturers around the world with customer-oriented solutions taken from a wide array of products and services.

BENTELER Automotive is part of the BENTELER Group, that is internationally active with its business divisions Automotive, Steel/Tube and Distribution. Since its foundation in 1876, four generations of the family have contributed to shaping the group, which is in family ownership. Today, the BENTELER Group is one of the largest industrial enterprises in Germany.
 
BENTELER employs about 30,000 persons at more than 160 locations in 40 countries.

Kautex - a division of Textron (TXT) - is headquarted in Bonn, Germany, and rated among the TOP 100 Automotive Suppliers worldwide.  Kautex is a leading global supplier of plastic fuel systems, selective catalytic reduction systems (SCR) and clear vision systems and sensor cleaning solutions. Furthermore, the company produces and supplies camshafts and industrial packaging. Kautex operates in 17 countries with 6,500 employees.

Imprint (Impressum) - please follow this link: http://www.kautex.de/index.php?id=395&L=1

Opel was founded by Adam Opel in Rüsselsheim, Germany in 1862 and is one of Europe’s largest automakers. Opel and its British sister brand Vauxhall sell over one million vehicles annually.

Opel is investing in future growth and conducting the largest model offensive in its history. The company will introduce 29 new models from 2016 to 2020. Opel reached a milestone of the model offensive in 2015 with the presentation of the new Astra compact car. The new Astra is a quantum leap in terms of efficiency, connectivity and innovative features. More than that, the brand has successfully entered new segments with vehicles such as the compact Mokka SUV, the small lifestyle ADAM and the elegant Cascada convertible.

Opel’s aim is to deliver high-tech for all customers in all segments – at affordable prices. The company makes German engineering expertise available for a broad spectrum of the population and surprises with innovative features previously only known from higher segments. The all-new Astra for example offers innovative assistance systems as well as the glarefree full-LED matrix light IntelliLux LED®.

The brand sees itself as a pioneer for the digital connection between humans and cars and sets new standards in the volume segment with the personal connectivity and service assistant Opel OnStar, which will turn new Opel cars into a 4G LTE mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot. On its way to becoming a provider of mobility services, Opel introduced innovative concepts such as the peer-to-peer car-sharing app CarUnity.

Opel is part of General Motors and is headquartered in Rüsselsheim. The company operates ten plants and three development and test centers in seven European countries. Opel/Vauxhall employs around 35,600 people in Europe, with more than 18,250 in Germany. Opel and Vauxhall are present in over 50 countries.

The Bertrandt Group has been providing development solutions for the international automotive and aviation industries for more than 40 years. With its subsidiary Bertrandt Services, the Group provides technical and commercial services throughout Germany in future-oriented sectors such as electrical engineering, energy, mechanical engineering and medical technology. A total of more than 12,500 employees at 52 locations guarantee a high level of expertise, sustainable project solutions and exceptional customer orientation.

You want to learn more about Bertrandt and Bertrandt Services? Visit us on our websites:  
http://www.bertrandt.com and http://www.bertrandt-services.com.

Further information on career opportunities and Bertrandt as an employer is available on our career website: 
http://www.bertrandt-karriere.com.

Visit us as well in social media:
https://www.xing.com/companies/bertrandt 
https://www.xing.com/companies/bertrandtservices 
https://www.facebook.com/bertrandtgroup 
http://www.youtube.com/user/bertrandtgroup 

Our imprint is available through the following link: http://www.bertrandt-karriere.com/en/imprint.html.

We are KOSTAL Group, a global, independent family-owned company based in Germany which develops and manufactures technologically complex electronic and mechatronic products. We employ more than 16.000 people at 46 locations in 21 countries, offering flexible, knowledgeable and customer-focused service.

The KOSTAL Group is divided into different Business Divisions: Automotive Electrical Systems, Industrial Electronics, Connectors and Test Technology (SOMA):

The division KOSTAL Automotive Electrical Systems is responsible for the development, production and distribution of components, modules and systems for the electrical, electronic and mechatronic technology in car bodies.

KOSTAL Industrie Elektrik GmbH, the industrial electronics division, develops innovative products for renewable energy generation and efficient energy use.

KOSTAL Kontakt Systeme GmbH operates all over the world to develop, manufacture and distribute innovative connector systems for automotive and industrial applications.

SOMA GmbH develops, manufactures and distributes test and automation systems for specific industries and products.


Impressum / Legal notice: http://www.kostal-career.com/legal-notice

Freudenberg Sealing Technologies (FST) is the world’s market and technology leader in sealing technology. While our work is often invisible, it is truly always essential. Our seals, featured in many well-known end products all over the world, make life that little bit easier for us. As Freudenberg’s largest Business Group, Freudenberg Sealing Technologies generated sales of more than € 2 billion in 2014 and employed some 15,000 people. 

Are you ready to start your career at Freudenberg?

Kromberg & Schubert look back on a story of success spanning more than 110 years.

Pioneering spirit and innovative entrepreneurship with a flat hierarchy has enabled the continuous expansion and globalisation of the company. With over 35.000 employees in over 30 locations, Kromberg & Schubert is today one of the global leaders in the supply of electrical systems, cables and plastic components.

The key to success is the company culture: Enthusias­m and motivation to provide creative product solutions are the engines of the interdisciplinary teams, who focus their energies on recognizing trends in the market at an early stage and also on addressing the individual requirements of our customers.

We keep automobile development in motion. 

There was a time when mobility influenced the development of our society. Now, it is society that influences the development of mobility. This transition gives rise to a number of questions: what will cars need to be like in the future, to meet the requirements of society? What changes will there be in utilisation, what changes in production? 

We develop the answers. 

EDAG, the world’s largest independent engineering expert, develops ready-for-production solutions to ensure the mobility of the future. With our holistic understanding of vehicles and production facilities, our role is to advance the evolution of product and production for our customers. Our aim is to improve mobility for the future - and this is what our success is based on. 

EDAG and our sister company, FFT Produktionssysteme GmbH & Co. KG, are represented on four continents, wherever the world's major vehicle manufacturers and suppliers require development services. Apart from engineering expertise, we also offer extensive external IT support and independent process consultation services in the product development market environment, under the name "Feynsinn".

We currently have more than 7,900 employees working at some 70 locations on tasks in complete vehicle development, the development of production solutions, in plant construction and the development and implementation of future-oriented concepts such as lightweight design, car sharing, e-mobility and additive manufacturing. 

The objectives we pursue are ambitious. As a result of our merger with Rücker, we intend to accelerate our growth in the next few years, to give new impetus to automobile development. Our objective is to bring about lasting improvements in the development of mobility - an aim that motivates each of us. And one which is firmly anchored in our award winning corporate culture. 

Discover the possibilities of automobile development. With EDAG.

Samvardhana Motherson Peguform (SMP) is a leading expert in plastic technologies and a system partner to the automotive industry. A specialist in cockpits, door panels, bumper modules and innovative plastic vehicle body parts, SMP has successfully established a footprint in Europe, China, Mexico and Brazil. 

In fiscal year 2013/2014, the company generated external revenue of 1.9 billion Euro. 10.000 employees around the globe are dedicated to meeting the complex demands of both today and tomorrows automotive industry in terms of quality, safety, aesthetics and economic efficiency. Global networking guarantees benefits to the whole group, including highly successful processes and vast industry expertise.

SMP is a member of Samvardhana Motherson Group, which has more than 70.000 employees and is one of the 50 largest automotive suppliers.

Market leading automotive tier-one supplier. Headquartered in Munich, Germany, with operations in Europe, US, Mexico, China, Japan, Korea.
Webasto Group based in Stockdorf near Munich has been a family-owned business ever since the company was founded in 1901. The group operates internationally at over 50 locations (over 30 of these production plants) in the divisions roof and thermo systems. Webasto is one of the top 100 automotive suppliers worldwide. In 2015 the Group realized a sales volume of 2.9 billion euros and has almost 12,000 employees. The company´s core competencies encompass the development, production and sales of complete roof and convertible systems as well as heating, cooling and ventilation systems for passenger cars, commercial and special vehicles, recreational vehicles and boats. For more information please visit www.webasto-group.com

Toyota Motorsport GmbH (TMG) is a unique high-performance development, testing and manufacturing facility located in the centre of Europe; in Cologne, Germany. 

Flexibility, precision and high performance are basic principles at TMG and our technical specialists have in-depth engineering experience across various sectors. 

Constructed to the highest standards with no compromise on quality or functionality, the spacious 30,000m² facility and its highly-skilled staff of around 250 offer a remarkable range of machines, facilities and expertise.

Additional to our work as an engineering services supplier to the automotive world, TMG is also home to Toyota's international works motorsport programmes. After spells in WRC and F1, TMG currently operates the TOYOTA Racing team in the FIA World Endurance Championship.

Drawing on this motorsport experience, TMG offers a range of vehicles for private motorsport participation, such as the GT86 CS-V3 which is eligible for the TMG GT86 Cup at the Nürburgring.

The Eberspächer Group: Driving the mobility of tomorrow

The Eberspächer Group is one of the world´s leading system developers and suppliers of exhaust technology, vehicle heaters and bus air conditioning systems. Eberspächer is also a professional innovation partner for the automotive industry in air conditioning of special-purpose vehicles and in automotive electronics.

Groundbreaking
All European, North American and increasingly Asian vehicle manufacturers utilize our groundbreaking technologies. Our comprehensive know-how with original equipment benefits the parts dealers and workshops that we supply around the globe.

Forward looking
We innovate rapidly to realize the mobility of tomorrow today. By offering groundbreaking solutions we are one step ahead to cope with the ever more stringent emission standards, the complex thermal management of electrical drive types as well as the constantly growing demands placed on vehicle electronics.

Flexible 
Eberspächer is an independent company with freedom to act. With approximately 8,600 employees in 25 countries in over 60 locations we are represented in all key markets of the worldwide automotive industry. We are consistently building up our international presence. Quality knows no borders.

Meet us at the following events: http://www.eberspaecher.com/en/event.html

Watch us on You Tube: https://www.youtube.com/user/eberspaechercom

Explore us worldwide: http://www.eberspaecher.com/en/worldwide.html

Ford-Werke GmbH: Ein Unternehmen mit langer Tradition am Standort Deutschland

Seit dem Start von Ford in Deutschland 1925 in Berlin hat der Automobilhersteller in Deutschland und Belgien mehr als 40 Millionen Fahrzeuge produziert. Köln ist seit 1930 Stammsitz des Unternehmens und seit 1998 auch der Sitz der Verwaltung von Ford Europa, die von hier aus 50 Märkte betreut.

Köln ist zudem das Stammwerk für die Produktion des Ford Fiesta. In der Domstadt beschäftigt der Hersteller 17.300 Mitarbeiter. Mehr als 6.000 kommen am Ford-Standort in Saarlouis hinzu, dem europäischen Stammwerk für den Ford Focus. Deutschlandweit sind rund 25.000 Mitarbeiter für Ford tätig. 

Mehr als 80 Prozent der Produktion in Köln und Saarlouis sind für den Export bestimmt – die wichtigsten Auslandsmärkte sind Großbritannien, Frankreich, Italien und Benelux. Aber auch weit entfernte Ziele wie Brunei, Japan und Tahiti werden beliefert.

Impressum: http://www.ford.de/Footer/Impressum

What We Develop Moves You

Employing over 6,500 members of staff, IAV is one of the world’s leading providers of engineering services to the automotive industry. 

The company has been developing innovative concepts and technologies for future vehicles for more than 30 years. Core competencies include production-ready solutions in all fields of electronics, powertrain and vehicle development. Clients include all of the world's premier automobile manufacturers and suppliers. In addition to development centers in Berlin, Gifhorn and Chemnitz/Stollberg, IAV also operates from other locations in Germany, Europe, Asia as well as North and South America.

Our story begins in 1916 – with a spring. Today we have about 10.200 employees at 28 locations in 17 different countries. The Mubea Group is a global market leader in the development and manufacture of automobile products with unique features that reduce vehicle weights and help protect the environment by lowering CO2 emissions.

We are committed to delivering sustainable business growth that creates value for customers, employees, shareholders, and the environment. As a family-owned business, with a high degree of flexibility and the ability to make quick decisions, we aim to achieve long term financial stability and profitability.

Our focus on technical innovation and operational excellence is driven by our ambition to become one of the Top 100 global automotive suppliers by 2020. Our exceptional technological know-how is also applied to products in the general industry.

Mazda Motor Europe, in conjunction with Mazda Logistics Europe & Mazda Research Europe, develops strategies, concepts and processes that successfully position Mazda in Europe – both for today and for the future. We put the customer at the heart of our activity. Our priority is to offer exceptional experiences to ensure that our customers celebrate driving. 

Now located on the banks of the river Rhine in Leverkusen, Germany, Mazda Motor Europe coordinates the operations of all National Sales Companies and independent distributors in more than 30 countries. Founded in 1989, but our roots in Europe go back to 1967 when Mazda began full-scale exports to the continent. 

An international team of more than 200 employees of Mazda Motor Europe works closely with the other European entities and the parent company in Japan to ensure flawless operations. Mazda Motor Europe and Mazda Logistics Europe have close relationships with all European Markets for quick decision-making in the community and to ensure that Mazda has ‘One Voice for Europe’. 

Mazda Logistics Europe is located in Willebroek, Belgium and is responsible for distributing cars and parts to all European customers across the continent. On top of its logistics activities, the team of more than 350 employees coordinates financial and IT services to all Mazda’s National Sales Companies.

At Mazda Research Europe, located in Oberursel, Germany, around 100 employees are analysing new technologies, developing parts and accessories for the European market and is one of Mazda’s three advanced design studios worldwide, focusing on the development of interior and exterior design for concept and future production cars. 

Awards Selection: RX-VISION named Most Beautiful Concept Car of the Year 2016 – Festival Automobile International Car of the Year Japan 2015-2016 – Mazda Roadster (known as MX-5 outside Japan) Red Dot Design Award: Best of the Best 2015 – MX-5 Red Dot Design Award: Winner 2015

ETAS provides innovative solutions for the development of embedded systems for the automotive industry and other sectors of the embedded industry. 

As a systems provider, ETAS supplies a multifaceted portfolio that covers the range from integrated tools and tool solutions to engineering services, consulting, training, and support. Security solutions in the area of embedded systems are offered by the ETAS subsidiary ESCRYPT. Established in 1994, ETAS GmbH is a 100-percent subsidiary of the Bosch Group, with international subsidiaries and sales offices in 12 countries in Europe, North and South America, and Asia.
specialities: Automotive and heavy duty diesel electronics

description:
GETRAG is a worldwide system supplier of transmissions system for passenger cars and light commercial vehicles with around 14,200 employees at 20 sites. GETRAG started out as a family business in 1935 and grew to the world’s largest independent manufacturer for passenger cars and light commercial vehicles.Our products range from manual transmissions to dual clutch transmissions through to transmissions for hybrid and electric drives.
On January 1st 2016, GETRAG was acquired by Magna International, the world’s second largest automotive supplier.

Customers rely on our experience and expertise in development and manufacture alike. We provide the concepts, build the prototypes and make the transmissions, which are often optimised in close cooperation with the automobile manufacturer – to the smallest manufacturing tolerances possible and in large series.

Focus on People
Employees from different countries and cultures work together at all the GETRAG sites throughout the world. This diversity within our teams helps us to be creative, to understand markets around the world, to combine strengths and share expertise.
Despite becoming a global player, we have always preserved our appreciation of each and every individual. We believe family-friendliness is more than just implementing measures for employees who want a career, but also have children to look after. With our origins as a family business, family-friendliness for us means taking into account the individual circumstances of every employee.
We adopted flexible working hours back in 2000 and we have also been offering the option to work from home occasionally for employees in the key departments and in the development departments.

Your engineering and consulting partner

Global approach 
The MBtech Group is an internationally leading engineering and consulting service provider focusing on the mobility industry. From the automotive industry to rail transport to aerospace, companies worldwide profit from the integrated solutions offered by MBtech as a member of the AKKA Technologies Group.

Your specialized partner in multiple business sectors
MBtech supports automotive and aircraft manufacturers and suppliers beginning with the detailed specifications, covering the design, calculation and testing onward to series maturity - regardless of whether components, systems or modules, whether new development, integration or testing are required. MBtech then combines these engineering competencies with customized consulting and training services. In addition, MBtech's customers enjoy the benefits of access to the expertise and resources of the entire AKKA network.

Here you get more information about the company and the services of MBtech:
http://www.mbtech-group.com

More about your job opportunities at MBtech:
career.mbtech-group.com

Vibracoustic is the leading supplier of anti-vibration solutions for the global automotive and commercial vehicle industries. The company came into being from the joint venture TrelleborgVibracoustic and generated sales of
EUR 1.9 bn in 2015. Vibracoustic has around 10,000 employees at 43 engineering and production sites, in 19 countries, who develop and produce powertrain and chassis components for automotive vibration control. For more information, see www.vibracoustic.com.

For 20 years, SAS has been synonymous with reliable and innovative know-how in the field of cockpit systems. As a Joint Venture of Continental and Faurecia, we have a safe and competent basis to fall back on, and we use our know-how in a highly focused and effective manner.

Formel D is the global service provider of the automotive industry. We develop market leading concepts as well as individual, scalable solutions along the entire automotive value chain – from the development to the production and up to the aftersales service.

Formel D was founded in 1993 at our headquarters in Troisdorf in Cologne. Today we employ several thousand people from 45 nations in more than 80 sectors in 19 countries.

Passion drives us, professionalism makes us stand out and team spirit makes us successful. For more than 20 years we have been offering our market-leading customers - automobile manufacturers and suppliers - expert solutions from product development to aftersales service. Formel D works at the core of the industry that moves us every day.

Welcome to Formel D. The driving force.

Welcome to BHTC

Behr-Hella Thermocontrol GmbH (BHTC) is one of the world's leading companies in climate control and thermal management for the automotive industry. The main product groups are control panels and control units for vehicle air conditioning as well as center stacks/HMI. Climate sensors, blower controllers and PTC auxiliary heaters complement the portfolio. BHTC covers the entire process from product design to the production of complete climate control systems. In this process BHTC combines all areas of expertise from software, electronics and mechanics to all other technologies necessary for the development and production of current and future operating and display elements.

Our benchmark is you.

We create comfort for people in motion. Our motto "Comfort in motion" stands for climate control and operation that allows all passengers in the car to feel comfortable. No matter what the climate zones, weather and driving conditions are like, we offer perfectly developed and matched products that make an essential contribution to relaxed and safe driving. Our portfolio includes control panels, control units, blower controllers and sensors.

Proximity to our customers, interdisciplinary cooperation and innovation power are the basis of our successful company development. At our locations in Germany, the USA, Mexico, China, India, Japan and Bulgaria we use the opportunities offered by global markets for purchasing, development and production.

In doing so, we rely on and trust in the dedicated and highly-qualified staff in our global business networks.
specialities: Control panels and control units for vehicle air conditioning
Climate sensors, blower controllers and PTC auxiliary heaters

description:
A desire to question what's possible has made Hyundai the world's fastest-growing automotive manufacturer.

It's why we achieved our highest-ever market share in Europe in 2012.

It's what made us the first automaker in the world to begin series-production of a zero tailpipe emission hydrogen-powered fuel cell car - the ix35 Fuel Cell.

And it's why we want to bring joy to everyone who has contact with us - whether they're driving one of our exciting vehicles, celebrating a passion for football at Hyundai-partnered FIFA and UEFA events, or watching our forthcoming i20WRC rally car roaring through a forest stage at high speed.

Part of the global Hyundai Motor Company, Hyundai Motor Europe (HME) is a dynamic, multinational company that oversees marketing, sales, aftersales, design and development activities across almost 30 European countries. We are located close to Frankfurt, with the HME Technical Centre, where Hyundai cars for Europe are designed and developed, situated just a few kilometres away. We will soon open our new vehicle test centre at the legendary Nuerburgring race track in Germany. 

We're always looking for talented and driven individuals to join our team. If you thrive in a dynamic environment that's challenging yet supportive, we invite you to look at our Careers page to see details of available positions.

http://www.hyundai.com/eu/en/Corporate/Careers/Vacancies/index.html

Kia Motors Europe is the European sales, marketing and service arm of the Kia Motors Corporation based in South Korea, responsible for marketing Kia products in 30 markets across Europe.

With its headquarters in the heart of Frankfurt, Germany, Kia has its finger on ‘the pulse of Europe’, delivering products, services and support to the rapidly growing number of Kia customers. Working at Kia is both challenging and rewarding, and the company structure encourages individuals to make vital contributions to its operations. The multi-cultural atmosphere is home to 27 different nationalities.

The company’s Frankfurt base houses one of Kia’s three global design centres, leading the effort to change perceptions of the Kia brand across Europe and worldwide. Its dedicated team of designers create concepts cars of the future, as well as production models for both Europe and the global market. For a decade, Kia’s European design centre has been at the forefront of the brand’s design-led transformation.

Today, Kia is among the fastest-growing brands in Europe and around the world. Since 2008, Kia’s European sales have increased every year. 2015 represented the brand’s eighth consecutive year of growth in Europe, with more than 380,000 cars sold.

Kia’s European production base, located in Žilina, Slovakia, supplies almost 60 percent of European demand for Kia products. The facility produces three vehicles for the European market – the cee’d model family (five-door hatchback and Sportswagon, as well as the three-door pro_cee’d coupe), the European-bestselling Sportage crossover, and Venga compact MPV.

Elektrobit (EB) is an award-winning and visionary global supplier of embedded solutions for the automotive industry. We stay on top of the latest innovations, such as connected cars, car as a sensor and autonomous driving.
A leader in automotive software, with over 27 years serving the industry, EB’s products power over 80 million vehicles and offer flexible, innovative software solutions for connected car infrastructure, human machine interface (HMI) technologies, navigation, driver assistance, electronic control units (ECUs), and software engineering services. 
EB is a wholly owned, independent subsidiary of Continental AG.
specialities: Embedded Software Solutions for the Automotive Industry

description: GETRAG Ford Transmissions GmbH is a 50/50 joint venture between GETRAG and Ford Europe. The GETRAG group is a worldwide system supplier of transmissions system for passenger cars and light commercial vehicles with around 14,200 employees at 20 sites. Product range from manual transmissions to dual clutch transmissions through transmissions for hybrid and electric drives. On January 1st 2016, the GETRAG group was acquired by Magna International, the world’s second largest automotive supplier.

KUKA Systems is the reliable specialist for innovative joining and forming processes for a wide range of materials as well as one of the world’s leading suppliers of automated production and assembly solutions for sustainable industrial manufacturing. 
The international system integrator stands out in systems, tool & die and special-machine engineering thanks to customer focus, technological leadership and superior solutions. Around 3,900 employees across all market sectors are working on automation solutions for the products of tomorrow — from engineering, project management and systems implementation through to after-sales service. 

Imprint: http://www.kuka-systems.com/en/imprint/

The BFFT Gesellschaft für Fahrzeugtechnik mbH is an automotive engineering developer that focuses on electrical systems and electronics (BFFT = Behr Fichtner Fahrzeugtechnik). The company was founded in 1998, has expanded continuously since then and is part of the EDAG Group since 2013. In 2015, the annual sales volume amounted to 76.4 million Euro. About 800 employees work at the headquarters in Gaimersheim near Ingolstadt (Bavaria) as well as in other offices in Germany, England, Italy and the USA. The range of products and services extends from initial concepts for pre-development, prototypes and series-ready system developments to their qualification and protection. Core competencies are driver assistance and energy storage systems as well as digitalization. Contractors and partners are international automotive and aviation industry companies and their suppliers.

DriveNow das innovative Mobilitätskonzept von BMW i, MINI und Sixt. 
Eine schicke Flotte aus BMW 1er, BMW X1, MINI Cabrios, MINI Clubman, und MINI Cooper steht in den Drive Now Städten für Sie bereit. Diese sind aktuell München, Berlin, Köln und Düsseldorf. Nach dem Motto: "Überall einsteigen, überall abstellen"​ können Sie verfügbare Autos über die App ausfindig machen und mit einem Chip auf Ihrem Führerschein öffnen. Das ganze ab 29 Cent pro Minute, inklusive Tankkosten und Parkgebühren. Sie können die Fahrzeuge überall im Geschäftsgebiet abstellen.

Preh is a globally operating group with more than nine decades of development and manufacturing experience. About 4.800 employees work on innovative technologies and individual customer solutions at locations in Germany, Portugal, Romania, Mexico, the United States and China. 

The company, founded in 1919, developed the „Preh-Funk“, one of the first radio receivers in the world. As an automotive supplier, its development and production expertise is focused on air conditioning and driver input systems for automobiles and commercial vehicles, controlling systems for battery management in electric vehicles, and assembly and automation systems. Preh offers a maximum of flexibility and speed in the development and production of tailor-made product solutions.

Innovation strength, strong customer orientation, diversity and team spirit are the cornerstones of our Group. Commitment to excellence, reliability and pro-active, responsible action belong to the company’s core values lived for more than 165 years.

In 2015, the Freudenberg Group employed over 40,000 people in some 60 countries worldwide and generated sales of more than 7,5 billion Euros (in-cluding pro-rata consolidation of 50:50 joint ventures).

TECOSIM is a world leading company in computer-aided engineering (CAE). The internationally active group has its headquarters in Germany and operates subsidiaries in the UK, India and Japan. With around 440 engineers, TECOSIM creates solutions for the transport, energy, industry & technology and health. With the aid of numerical calculation and simulation at the early stages of product development, specialists simulate the behaviour of components under different environmental influences and then visualise the result. This method increases effectiveness and saves costs.

TECOSIM has placed a sharp focus on its international growth and is looking for qualified employees who are able to help with this transformation. There is a particular need for engineers qualified in mechanical engineering, vehicle technology and construction engineering as well as physicists, mathematicians, technicians and career changers with a technical background. TECOSIM offers attractive career opportunities in exchange. Its multi-stage personnel development programmes take into account the individual strengths and wishes of each employee. TECOSIM is a TOP employer and has received the Job and Family seal of approval as a family-friendly enterprise.

TECOSIM's development services and products enable it to improve people's lives with regard to safety, comfort and the environment, as expressed in its brand promise 'Better life by simulation.'​

Hengst has more than 3,000 employees worldwide at eleven locations in Germany, Brazil, China, India, Poland, Singapore and North America. Automotive, Display, Electronics, Energy and Strategic Build-up – these are the 5 business divisions of the multinational Prettl group. JOST is the worldwide leading producer of vehicle connection components for systems, modules and components for trucks & trailers. Under the umbrella brand name of JOST, the comprehensive range of products is broken down into three areas: The JOST brand includes fifth wheel couplings, telescopic landing gears and accessories for semi-trailers, ball bearing turntables, king pins and container locks and components for alternating systems. Under the traditional brand name of ROCKINGER, the company produces towing hitches, drawbar eyes and towing drawbars for both transporters and trucks, as well as for use in the agricultural industry. TRIDEC is the leading pro- vider of steering systems and axle suspensions for trailers. EDBRO is the leading company in the field of vehicle-mounted hydraulic systems. The product portfolio includes front-end, underbody, tipping and trailer-thrust- cylinders, as well as customised hydraulic kit solutions.
JOST is the only supplier that can provide its products and services all around the world. The company is located on all continents, with distribution, production and development. With sales and production facilities in 18 countries, JOST is the global partner of choice for the commercial vehicle industry. JOST has over 2,000 staff worldwide.

During the designing process of our cars, we rely as heavily as ever on the principle that quality will always prevail. Thus, every inch, every curve, and every angle is of great significance. This is why our cars provide unmatched Fahrvergnügen at the highest speeds, on all surfaces and under all conditions - whether you are driving in the rain, in the sun, or during a snowstorm. Even if the issue were as small as the seam in the trunk: we consider the slightest cutbacks an inexcusable irreverence. Diligence and highest precision are simply innate to us. 

Vorsprung durch Technik. 
 
Ever since the early beginnings, advanced technologies have been the driving force behind Audi. Putting this into practice, it translates into a continuous striving for new and better solutions addressing all challenges of the auto industry in this ever-changing world. Our mutual responsibility for our planet as well as the understanding of our impact on it are just as important. We learn from the past in order to gain insight into the future. This is how we comprehend progress; and progress is the moving power behind all our actions here at Audi. 


Throughout Switzerland, 65 Audi dealerships sell our vehicles and provide their customers with a competent customer service.

Röchling Automotive’s core competencies include aerodynamics and acoustics in each segment of the vehicle. Air management consists of the optimization of airflows within the vehicle – whether in cooling air ducts, intake pipes, and intake manifolds in the engine compartment, air channels within the passenger compartment, or at the underbody. It is all about airflow, aerodynamic drag, and air turbulence. Ultimately, an efficient flow distribution means less energy input and, consequently, less fuel consumption.

Namhafter Automobilzulieferer

Telemotive ist einer der namhaftesten Automobilzulieferer - sowohl für technologische Produkte als auch für Engineering-Leistungen. Die Stärke beider Bereiche und deren intensive Vernetzung sind einzigartig. Seit 2016 ist das Unternehmen Teil des globalen Automobilzulieferers Magna International und gehört der Magna Steyr-Gruppe an. 

Engineering-Leistungen und technologische Produkte

Die Kernkompetenzen im Engineering sind Bussysteme, Infotainment, Konnektivität, Fahrerassistenz, Fahrzeugdiagnose, Elektromobilität und EMV. Das Leistungsspektrum beinhaltet Systemintegration, Projektmanagement und Technologieberatung, außerdem Hard- und Softwareentwicklung sowie Tests und Dokumentation im eigenen Test-/Systemhaus oder der Teststrecke Car2Road. Die Produktpalette besteht im Bereich Hardware aus Datenloggern, Elektronik für Laboraufbauten und Testtools für das Gesamtfahrzeug. Im Bereich Software bietet Telemotive speziell konfigurierbare Anwendungen für Tests und Dokumentationen an. 

Top-Kunden an fünf Standorten

Das Unternehmen wurde im Jahre 2000 in Wiesensteig gegründet und betreibt neben dem Hauptsitz in Mühlhausen Standorte in München, Ingolstadt, Wolfsburg und Böblingen. Mittlerweile beschäftigt Telemotive über 600 Mitarbeiter. Zum Kundenportfolio zählen bekannte Automobilkonzerne wie BMW, AUDI, Daimler, Porsche und Volkswagen, sowie Zulieferer.

IPETRONIK GmbH & Co. KG is a globally operating company for mobile measurement technologies, DAQ software, engineering services and test bench technology for the automotive industry. 
The combination of these strategically interrelated business divisions is unique to today's market.
Since the company's founding in 1989, OEMs and Tier 1 suppliers have relied on the high quality, reliability and precision of IPETRONIK products and services to meet demanding research, development and testing requirements in automotive and numerous other industrial applications.

An extensive portfolio of ultra-precise measurement modules, data loggers, sensors – together with an efficient configuration and data acquisition software – offers latest, field-proven technology for data bus, protocol and control unit requirements. Furthermore, the company has wide-ranging competence in the area of vehicle testing, bench testing, climate acoustics and thermal management. Additionally, IPETRONIK has many years of experience planning, construction and operation of test benches.
The innovative solutions are developed and produced in Germany. A worldwide distribution network and its own subsidiaries ensure global distribution with local support.
With the integration of Savvy Telematic Systems AG und CAETEC GmbH, IPETRONIK GmbH & Co. KG receives two subsidiary companies, which are specialized in telematics solutions & business intelligence as well as in high-performance data loggers for on-board power supply development and fleet testing. Since 2001, IPETRONIK is owned by INDUS Holding AG.

We deliver the future.

With its ecologically sound production procedures and its comprehensive training programmes, the company ensures that future generations will be able to rely on KRONE standards.

F.S. Fehrer Automotive GmbH is an international specialist in automobile interior components.

Founded in 1875 in Kitzingen, the Fehrer family business is characterised today by designated customer-oriented service centres and international production facilities in close geographical proximity to its partners.

As a developer and series supplier, Fehrer provides comprehensive, tailored full-service through the entire value added chain – from the individual development of suitable material formulations, via innovative engineering, mould and tool construction to reliable series production.

Fehrer’ s development expertise and broad range of specialist knowledge throughout the entire value added chain and beyond, constitute the right prerequisites for responding to future customer requirements and for realising product innovation in direct cooperation with partners in the automobile industry.

Novero develops, manufactures and markets flexible solutions for vehicle communication, telematics and mobile device integration.

Our main focus is on modular control units (gateways) for highly secure data transfer. Novero gateways are used for remote diagnosis and maintenance of vehicles, as well as for track and trace or the evaluation of driving behavior. The product portfolio is completed with comfort technologies for integrating mobile devices, such as wireless charging and providing the best possible reception inside the car with the help of patented high-frequency methods and antenna coupling. Developments are influenced by current technology standards such as LTE, 802.11 or Bluetooth Low Energy as well as the input and specific needs of our customers.

Well-known automobile manufacturers such as Audi, Bentley, BMW, DAF, Jaguar, Land Rover, MAN, Mercedes Benz, Skoda, Ford and Volkswagen rely on the innovation and implementation expertise of the company.

Currently around 400 dedicated employees - including more than 150 engineers and IT specialists - work at the development and production sites in Bochum, Dabendorf, Toronto and Bucharest.

More information at: www.novero.com

Novem is a global supplier of high-quality decorative components and functional elements for vehicle interiors. The company, with headquarters in Vorbach/Upper Palatinate in Bavaria, is the world’s number one source for fine wood decorative components. As well as processing fine woods, Novem also works on innovative plastic and metal engineering, making the company an excellent system supplier. 

Novem’s efficient project management ensures that the company can supply all decorative elements for any vehicle interior system. 

Leading automotive manufacturers and premium-class suppliers trust in our sophisticated design and construction services, made in Bavaria. Our customers include all renowned automotive manufacturers. Novem currently employs approx. 5,000 staff in eleven worldwide locations.

From its beginnings under the name of Hyundai Precision Industry in 1977, MOBIS went on to become the world’s top container producer. After turning its focus to the automobile sector, in the 1990s MOBIS produced recreational vehicles like the Galloper and Santamo to create the “Galloper Legend”. 

1990 MOBIS redesigned itself as an auto parts specialist. 

Hyundai Precision started to produce and supply chassis modules for Hyundai Motor and took the after-sales service parts businesses from both Hyundai and Kia motors in late 1999, and the company was renamed as MOBIS, kicking off the new millennium. 2000 was the year that MOBIS not only changed its name, but also became the biggest automotive parts company in charge of after-sales service parts distribution, auto parts export and module manufacturing. 

Against this backdrop, another adventure is awaiting MOBIS, as the company merged with Hyundai Autonet in 2009. The future technologies for automobiles need a systematic integration of both mechanical and electronic parts and MOBIS is now prepared to take on the future. 

As a leader in the auto parts sector in Korea, MOBIS will take the next jump to reach the goal of becoming a ‘Global Top 5.’

TVSMILES is on a mission to get the most out of advertisements and turn viewers into customers again. The app combines ads, games and an extensive mobile loyalty program in a unique way. Instead of simply showing ungainly ads that aren’t adapted to mobile, TVSMILES stages ads as a trivia game and rewards users for engaging with Smiles, the official in-app currency. The users can then redeem the Smiles for cool products and vouchers.

The concept has been warmly accepted by its users – success by facts:

•	More than two million registrations in Germany & the UK
•	More than 150,000 5 star ratings
•	20 million video views per month
•	400 million ad impressions per month
•	National awards: made-in-de award (22nd May 2014), Gruenderszene award (6th August 2014) and the   webinale award (9th June 2015)

TVSMILES is a fast and direct advertising channel to reach Generation Y’s who are more and more withdrawing from classic advertising. The TVSMILES user is a mobile-first user. Not to mention the fact that ad blockers usually shield this target group. Generation Y’s simply ask the question: “What’s in it for me?” and here is the answer: With gamification and an appealing rewards program, TVSMILES brings advertisements back to this user.

Join the success story!

The BENTELER-Group stands for first-class materials, production, and technological expertise in the areas of Automotive, Steel/Tubes and Distribution.

As a family-owned business in the fourth generation, the company generated revenue of 7.6 billion euros in 2014.

Sumitomo Electric Bordnetze (SEBN) is a global automotive supplier with more than 28,000 employees in 15 countries. SEBN is a member of the Japanese Sumitomo Electric Industries Group, whose roots go back over 400 years, with some 380 subsidiaries in various industries worldwide.

"WE CREATE CHARACTER –  Innovations by the DRÄXLMAIER Group mark the character of premium automobiles worldwide. As a systems partner to notable automobile manufacturers such as Audi, BMW, Bugatti, Jaguar, Lamborghini, Land Rover, Maserati, Mercedes-Benz, MINI, Porsche, Tesla and Volkswagen, we develop and manufacture complex wiring harness systems, central electrical and electronic parts, exclusive interiors and storage systems for electro-mobility. We supply the whole process chain, from the very first idea, the development and production process, right up to just in sequence delivery to our customers.

The DRÄXLMAIER Group is one of the top 100 automobile suppliers in the world and operates at more than 60 sites in over 20 countries. Founded in Germany in 1958, it now employs more than 55,000 people worldwide. 
In 2015, our company reached sales of 3.7 billion Euros.

Fascination for the automobile is what marks our products and motivates our employees. Together with their passion for the automobile and enthusiasm for anything new, their commitment is an excellent prerequisite for finding continually new, intelligent, sustainable ways of shaping the character of the automobile.  
At DRÄXLMAIER, young professionals can pursue their careers in the automobile industry. Those with work experience will find new challenges and individual ways of furthering their development at our company. As an owner-managed family company, we feel a particular obligation towards our employees. We are convinced that a responsible, long-term way of thinking is essential for economic success.

We offer attractive positions, particularly in the field of technology, engineering and information technology.

At www.draexlmaier.jobs you will find all the information concerning career opportunities at DRÄXLMAIER. 
For more information concerning the organization and the products of DRÄXLMAIER, please visit: www.draexlmaier.com"

Sustainable and modern mobility are the main objectives of the VDA. The VDA nationally and internationally promotes the interests of the entire German automotive industry. It can bank on a strong power base of members consisting of automobile manufacturers, suppliers and manufacturers of trailers, special bodies and buses. Unlike in many other countries, they are organized under one association, resulting in decisive advantages for the German automotive industry through direct dialogue and rapid decision-making.

In the interest of all its members, the VDA is active in all areas of the motor traffic industry like economic and transport policy, technical legislation, quality assurance and taxation. In addition, the environment and climate protection are of particular importance. The VDA is also the organizer of international motor shows for passenger cars and commercial vehicles, which always draw the great interest of the experts and public alike.

Innovation for Appealing, Reliable Mobility

Carmeq is a Volkswagen Group company working for the international automotive and automotive supplier industries. Our core business is software for onboard electronics. As an innovative developer, expert consultant and experienced project manager, we develop current trends and support our customers through all phases of implementing novel solutions – from the creation of technical concepts to their practical realization. In the process, we rely on the latest technologies and methods. 
With around 400 employees, we work on pioneering solutions for appealing, reliable mobility. Our headquarters is situated in Berlin, Germany with additional locations in Wolfsburg and Ingolstadt.

LINDE + WIEMANN - a medium-sized company with a long tradition. Well known for quality, famed for its unconventional thinking, appreciated for its values: INNER VALUES.

As an owner-managed, medium-sized enterprise we partner the international automobile industry. For over 70 years we have supplied globally active car manufacturers and their suppliers with relevant structural components and assemblies.

We apply our know-how, gained through many years of experience, to design and form metal to find the right trendsetting solutions tailor-made to suit our customers’ requirements. We focus on developing new products that contribute towards improving the safety of vehicles while reducing their weight at the same time.

Emitec Gesellschaft für Emissionstechnologie mbH was founded in 1986. Today, the company is a world leader on the metal substrate market for exhaust gas catalysts and metallic diesel particulate filters for vehicles and mobile machinery. Complete SCR dosing systems round off this product range. Since its foundation Emitec has sold more than 170 million metal substrates of zero-defect quality. 

Emitec is also a long-standing development partner of engine and automobile manufacturers, from two-wheelers to cars and commercial vehicles, as well as of the agricultural and construction machinery industry. The company usually works together with its customers to develop products and systems at its research and test center. Emitec owns more than 2,700 patents worldwide, a fact that reflects the company’s innovative strength. 

Emitec employs around 900 people at its plants in Lohmar and Eisenach (Germany), in Faulquemont (France), in Fountain Inn (USA) and in Pune (India). Development centres are located in Germany, France and Denmark. Further subsidiaries are situated in Shanghai, Tokyo, Seoul and Rochester Hills (Detroit).

The company’s customers include the major car, truck and motorcycle manufacturers from across the world as well as in the non-road sector producers of tractors, agricultural machinery, construction equipment, ship engines and diesel locomotives.
specialities: Metallic Substrates for Exhaust Gas After Treatment

Control€xpert - Redefining Rules
We developed an automated process, with which damage and maintenance documents of any format are transformed into structured records. A database-driven cost review clarifies whether everything is right - and in cases of doubt, our experts take a closer look. Our customers get the results as a test report or as detailed reporting. It is as simple as that! 
As a service provider in the data, damage and quality management, we are working for a variety of businesses such as insurance companies, car manufacturers, fleet and leasing companies. On their behalf, we undertake to verify cost estimates, invoices and expert reports.

Neapco Europe is a designer, manufacturer and supplier of driveshafts, differentials, die-cast aluminum housings and component parts serving the global automotive industry. It has manufacturing and distribution locations in Germany and Poland and was acquired in June 2010 by Neapco Holdings, LLC a North America based supplier of automotive driveline products.

Magirus – 150 years of fire protection technology tradition

The best fire-fighting vehicles are built by fire-fighters. This fact was known to Conrad Dietrich Magirus, fire-fighter by passion, visionary and founder of our company 150 years ago. In keeping with this tradition, today we at Magirus build the most modern and most reliable fire-fighting vehicles, ladders, pumps and fire pumps. And today many employees at Magirus are trained comrade fire-fighters who know exactly what's needed on the job.

The work of our comrades in fire-fighting services around the world is an inspiration as well as motivation, since their mission is what drives us. This is also the reason why the equipment, vehicles and solutions we develop for our comrades are among the best in the world. 

For over 150 years now they have been making fire-fighters' lives easier and their work safer. Today at Magirus fire brigades find a comprehensive range of first-class, reliable fire-fighting vehicles, turntable ladders, rescue vehicles and equipment vehicles, special solutions, pumps and fire pumps.

Magirus currently employs employees at four locations. In Ulm the "Competence Centre for Fire Protection" consolidates the most important processes of the company at a single location. Due to its membership in CNH Industrial with approximately 71,200 employees worldwide, Magirus can rely on a worldwide network with the greatest possible expertise in the area of automotive engineering.

Mit den Komponenten BMW, BMW M, BMW i, den BMW Motorrädern und dem MINI Center Oldenburg repräsentieren wir ganzheitlich die vielfältige Produktpalette der BMW-Gruppe. Besonders stolz sind wir, dass wir als eines der ersten Musterunternehmen das Zukunftsprojekt “Future Retail” umsetzen durften. Damit realisieren wir nach neuesten weltweiten Standards die Zukunftsgestaltung eines BMW-Handelsbetriebes. “Es ist  schwerer geworden, für den sich stark wandelnden Markt immer richtig aufgestellt zu sein”, so Geschäftsführer Tammo Kayser, der bereits seit den 1980er Jahren gemeinsam mit seiner Frau Gudrun die Geschicke der BMW Freese-Gruppe steuert. “Seit Jahren erhalten wir immer wieder Bestnoten in der Kundenzufriedenheit, weil wir mit intelligenten Systemen wie unserem iFeedback die wirklichen Bedürfnisse der Kunden erfassen und darauf reagieren.”

Absolute Kundenzufriedenheit ist unser oberstes Ziel, dessen Erreichen wir mit jeder Handlung in unserem Unternehmen anstreben.

Ihr
Tammo Kayser
Geschäftsführender Gesellschafter
specialities: Aftersales BMW / MINI / Motorrad / BMW i

description:
Mercedes-Benz Consulting – Promoting Retail Excellence
As a wholly owned subsidiary of Daimler AG, we at Mercedes-Benz Consulting GmbH have been involved in international training and consulting for almost 20 years. Our expertise covers the entire sales services spectrum, from sales performance, customer experience and digital performance to after-sales, mobility and connectivity. 

Consultants, trainers, and coaches with years of experience and outstanding professional and process knowledge work in our Centers of Excellence. Our customers value our in-depth understanding of knowledge transfer and long-term results. Being in dialog with all the contact people in the company puts us on an equal footing with our clients to understand their business, and develop the ideal solutions everyone can reproduce.
Our customers include worldwide corporations, and even middle-sized companies in other industries, in addition to Mercedes-Benz. 

Since our founding in 1997 our company has grown steadily and is now present in nearly 100 countries with more than 230 employees.

unu creates the perfect mobility solution that connects the people with their city.

The unu founders, Elias Atahi and Pascal Blum came to the same conclusion: in order to get the most out of a city, urban mobility is key. They returned home from Asia with a visionary idea in their minds.

unu developed the smart electric scooter that is all about cities, enabling everybody to embrace the full potential of their own urban environment. Available in a range of body and trim colours, the battery-powered scooter has a plush leather saddle with room for a pillion passenger. The Berlin based team’s emphasis on simplicity goes beyond unu’s attractive design, offering customer-friendly doorstep delivery, direct insurance plans in selected countries and a service partnership with Bosch and DHL in the logistics sector.

The battery case allows for easy portability and recharging at any standard plug. Ensures that the environmentally compatible vehicle is never running on empty. It’s thoughtful features like this that make the unu an electric scooter that is ready to go the extra mile.

unumotors.com 
embrace urban life

With our extensive experience in electrical-/electronics system integration, we offer powerful solutions both in practical test implementation and in the quality and project management stage of electrical-/electronic system integration.

THE KÄMMERER GROUP
-an innovative engineering service

Thanks to approx. 350 specialists at 11 locations across Germany, Austria and Poland, we support our customers based on our comprehensive principle - in course of introduction of new systems and processes, exceeding the classic notion of engineering. Thanks to an interdisciplinary mix of our competences, synergies are created allowing innovative and creative solution approaches.

As an owner-run company, we base our range of services, exceeding technology limitations in a tailored manner, on the requirements of our customers, and we guarantee highest flexibility and customer gains. And so, we deliver ideas for competitive edge solutions along the entire process chain.

From the first concept, all the way to a mature series product, our customers profit from our know-how, especially in terms of interior and electronic development.

Exceeding branch limitations, we develop high-value and complicated components in the premium segment of motor vehicle, rail vehicle and aircraft construction.

Cinemo is a global leader in automotive grade multimedia playback, streaming, media management and connectivity middleware in the embedded world. CPU and Operating System agnostic as well as highly optimized for low power and low footprint devices, Cinemo's unified middleware solutions decode, play, render, stream, manage and index virtually any file, disc, connected device and streaming format. 

Designed and optimized for the high quality requirements of the automotive industry, Cinemoâ€™s solutions can be seamlessly integrated into entry, mid and high automotive / in-vehicle infotainment system head and rear seat units, as well as automotive Apps enabling powerful new use cases.

Cinemo GmbH is a privately held German Corporation, headquartered in Karlsruhe, Germany. With a dedicated and strong engineering team, Cinemo's technologies represent the best in their class.

For more information, please visit www.cinemo.com

Mobility is our passion,
Sintered steel our profession

The PMG group is dedicated to one of the most important human needs - mobility

Megacities are growing continuously. Distances between home and workplace are becoming greater. Global import and export is an essential part of our economic life. Demands on mobility and thus on motorization rise with each day. The challenge is to become faster, less expensive, more reliable and friendlier to the environment. 
With six of its own production facilities on three continents and over 50 years of experience, the entire Powder Metal Group (PMG) is dedicated to the creation of innovative solutions that meet the needs of modern mobility. OEMs and First Tier Suppliers all over the world trust in our customized components and systems for automotive applications. We have the capabilities to partner our customers at every project stage; from design, engineering and prototyping through testing and validation to series production and stock management.

Wir sind ein Team aus erfahrenen Ingenieuren, Technikern und spezialisierten Fachkräften, das Dienstleistungen rund um die Entwicklung, Beratung, Konstruktion und Fertigung anbietet.
Unsere Projektingenieure und Konstrukteure, Softwareanwender, Hardwarespezialisten und unsere Projektmanager erarbeiten individuelle und effiziente Lösungen für die Aufgaben und Visionen unterschiedlichster Branchen.
Unsere Kernkompetenzen sind in der Automotive- und Nutzfahrzeugbranche gebündelt. Aber auch im Maschinen- und Anlagenbau bis hin zur Medizintechnik und Konsumgüterindustrie gehören wir zu den Top-Anbietern kreativer durchdachter Engineering-Dienstleistungen in Deutschland.

Elastomer Solutions (previous Diehl Elastomertechnik) started in Germany in 1974 with the acquisition by Diehl Group of a rubber plant to produce components for its defense division.
The group acquired competences in development and production of rubber and plastic components mainly for the automotive industry and for the last 20 years has been one of the most reliable partners in development and production of elastomeric components for a wide range of applications in automotive engineering.
Currently, Elastomer Solutions is a leading  full service supplier of rubber , rubber-to-plastic and thermoplastic componentes.
It has production plants in Slovakia, Portugal, Morocco and México. Sales and development are located in Germany and USA.

Ever since its managing director Dr. Ulrich Lages founded Ibeo Automotive Systems GmbH in 1998, a steadily growing workforce has embraced his vision. 

Today 45 employees are engaged in refining laser scanners and thus fostering the company's success and its pursuit of accident-free motoring. This development has enabled Ibeo to establish worldwide technological leadership in the laser scanner segment with the protection of more than 80 patents. It has also promoted the widespread acceptance of laser technology in the automotive industry. 

Outstanding laser scanning and software technology have lead to ADAS (advanced driver assistance systems) and HAD (highly automated driving) systems that generate real-time knowledge of the current driving situation and can suggest specific actions or perform specific actions. 

Ibeo Reference products facilitate the ADAS development process by providing a benchmark reference for third-party ADAS systems. Real world scenarios are being generated using high definition laser scanners and Ibeo Evaluation Suite software. This leads to object tracking, lane mark detection and curb stone detection. 

With several exceptional projects Ibeo Automotive tries to set the bar higher to achieve better results. 

The mission of integrating laser scanners in cars remains the drive force of the Ibeo team to make driving more safe and comfortable.
specialities: Development of outdoor laser scanners to make driving more safe and comfortable
Developing reference systems for third-party ADAS systems

C&S group GmbH, stands for communication & systems group, is a spin-off of a former research entity at the University Ostfalia in Wolfenbüttel, Germany. We enjoy an international appreciation, not only as independent testing company, but also as competent partner for the analysis and conception of automotive networked systems and their testability.

As accredited test house according to ISO17025, we conduct conformance and interoperability tests for HW components of different customer specific and standardized IVN protocols such as CAN, LIN, FlexRay. Following the E/E architectures’ trends we are expanding our services to cover the emerging protocols CAN FD and BroadR-Reach automotive Ethernet.

Furthermore C&S offers testing solutions and consultancy services for SW modules, supporting the migration to AUTOSAR compliant architectures as well as integration tests of BSW stacks.
Our long-lasting testing experiences are also applied in our consulting services for the conception and safeguarding of the proper operability of networked systems.
We participate in standard-setting organizations like ISO, SAE, FlexRay, LIN, AUTOSAR, OPEN, etc. C&S is represented by partners in Europe, Japan and the US.

Paul Nutzfahrzeuge GmbH is located at the Lower Bavarian city of Vilshofen on the Danube. The company is one of the European market leaders in special-purpose vehicle conversion and construction. Within the past years, this business area within the Paul Group has developed into a successful global player that serves companies all over the world.

Today, the complete in-house development of own vehicle concepts such as the "Heavy Mover" heavy-load giant, or towing trucks for agricultural transport tasks, special municipal service tasks and highly-specialized applications with the most diverse implements are the domain of the special vehicle manufacturer at Vilshofen.

The experts from Lower Bavaria are always in demand when customer-specific requirements include extraordinary technical solutions. Commercial vehicles manufactured at the special-purpose vehicle construction forge are in demand all over the world for use in agriculture and forestry, in the construction and building industry, at fire-fighting brigades, in the non-civil sector and in municipal fields of application.
 
Carrier vehicles for the heaviest concrete pumps or crane superstructures, multi-axle long-bed chassis for fire brigades on airfields are as much part of the daily work as the mounting  of additional axles for Unimog special applications in the energy, mining and construction sector. The range of special-purpose chassis developed and built at Vilshofen also comprises customized buses and visitor trains, all-wheel-driven extra heavy-duty all-terrain transport vehicles for combined dual-use applications in agriculture and municipal services – this is just to name a few examples from the broad range of chassis conversions and developments made by Paul Nutzfahrzeuge.

Die Röchling Automotive-Gruppe ist mit über 4.200 Mitarbeitern weltweit Partner von Automobilherstellern und Systemlieferanten. 22 Fertigungsstätten, verteilt auf 4 Kontinente, gewährleisten Kundennähe, 4 Entwicklungsstandorte schaffen nachhaltig Nutzen für den Endkunden. Die intensive Betreuung der Automobilhersteller erfolgt mehrheitlich in Kundenbüros unmittelbar vor Ort. 

Zu den Kernkompetenzen von Röchling Automotive gehören die Aerodynamik, Akustik und das Thermomanagement in jedem Segment des Fahrzeugs. Das Luftmanagement umfasst die Optimierung der Luftströmungen innerhalb eines Fahrzeugs. Sowohl in den steuerbaren Luftführungen, Ansaugleitungen und Saugrohren des Motorraums als auch am Unterboden oder in den Luftkanälen innerhalb des Fahrgastraums. Letzten Endes bedeutet eine effiziente Strömungsverteilung weniger Energieaufwand und damit Kraftstoffverbrauch. 

Eine andere Stärke von Röchling Automotive, mit positiven Auswirkungen auf die Emissionen, liegt in der Steigerung des Akustikkomforts unter Beachtung der Gesetze des Leichtbaus. 

Weitere bedeutende Themen für Röchling Automotive sind darüber hinaus Fluidkomponenten und -Systeme, bei denen es neben einem hohen Maß an Funktionsintegration um Kosteneffizienz und natürlich um das Thema Leichtbau geht. In der Gruppe werden systematisch die verschiedenen Spezialdisziplinen vernetzt und so Kompetenzen gebündelt.

Based in Hamburg, Germany, Edel AG, the European entertainment and full-service provider, has over 900 employees in seven European countries. With the purchase of the book division from the renowned publisher Pabel-Moewig Verlag as well as a further publisher Rockbuch Verlag and the establishment of its own publishing division Edel EDITION, Edel has been engaged in book business since the beginning of 2007 and is pursuing a strategy aimed at making book publishing a key mainstay of its business.

The provision of professional services for other members of the industry and the exploitation of proprietary content covering the entire range of media formats sets the company clearly apart from its peers in the European market.

INFITEC GmbH is a technology company located in Gerstetten, a result of a research project of Daimler in 1999, to overcome the problem of developing fatigue due to long working hours while using 3D glasses. The result of this very successful project was patented as Interference Filter Technology, which created a new standard on the market for 3D visualization systems. During more than a decade of expertise and research, INFITEC held partnership with many companies known for excellence in research and simulation labs around the globe, and received various positive feedbacks on many advantages of the technology, such as:
• No Ghosting
• No Fatigue
• No Special Screen Required
• No Hotspots
• Robust passive glasses

Langes Sitzen im Auto ist in der mobilen Gesellschaft zum Alltagsproblem geworden. Ob im Außendienst, auf den täglichen Fahrten zur Arbeitsstätte oder auf dem Weg in den Urlaub - Heutzutage ist das Auto weit mehr als ein Fortbewegungsmittel. 

Für die Zeiten zwischen den Rastplätzen oder Terminen entwickelt und produziert Alfmeier seit vielen Jahren Sitzkomfortsysteme, die zusätzliche Einstellungsmöglichkeiten bieten, damit Fahrzeugsitze direkt auf die Anatomie der Insassen angepasst werden können.

•Statische Komfortsysteme (Lordosenstützen, Seitenwangenverstellung, SMA-Ventile)

•Dynamische Komfortsysteme (Massagesysteme, Verteilerventile)

•Kopfstützen (Klappbare und absenkbare Kopfstützen)

•Druckversorgungen (Luftkompressoren für den Verbau im Sitz oder Kofferraum)
